children.name: the type of food that sb usually eats
well-balanced
children.definition: (of ameal or diet) containing all the different things you need to keep you healthy : hài hoà
examples: a well-balanced meal /diet

children.name: unbalanced
children.definition: (of ameal or diet)not consisting of a combination of the correct types and amounts of food : không cân bằng

children.name: an unbalanced diet
examples: There should always be variety in the cooking methods - too much deep frying or wok cooking makes an unbalanced meal.

children.name: nutritious
children.definition: (of a diet or meal) containing many of the substances needed for life and growth : bổ dưỡng , giàu dinh dưỡng

children.name: a nutritious diet
examples: The cookbook contains many simple yethighly nutritiousmeals.

children.name: diet
children.definition: the type of food that sb usually eats :
examples: The doctor told him to reduce the amount of fat in his diet.
diet of
For 27 years in the jungles of Guam, Yokoi survived on a diet of shrimp, coconuts, snails, frogs and rats.
They exist on a diet of fish.
in sb’s diet
the importance of vitamins and minerals in your diet
For hundreds of years potatoes were their staple diet.
People in the coastal region live on a staple diet of rice and fish.
dietary[adj] related to the food sb eats →nutritional:
Dietaryhabitscan be very difficult to change.
Do you have any special dietaryrequirements?
dietetics[ U ] the scientific study of the food that people eat and its effects on health : khoa dinh dưỡng
dietician/ dietitian[ C ] a person who scientifically studies, and gives advice about, food and eating : chuyên gia dinh dưỡng

children.name: healthy/good
examples: A healthy diet includes plenty of fresh fruit and vegetables.

children.name: poor/unhealthy
examples: A poor diet affects your skin and hair condition.

children.name: a balanced diet
children.definition: including all the types of food that people need
examples: A balanced diet is important for a child’s development.

children.name: a varied diet
children.definition: including many different foods
examples: Provide your fish with a varied diet of worms, insects, and dried food.

children.name: a sensible/proper diet
examples: Students don’t always eat a sensible diet.

children.name: a staple diet
children.definition: the food that a group of people or type of animal normally eats

children.name: a vegetarian diet
children.definition: that does not include any meat or fish

children.name: a low-fat/ high-fibre/high-protein etc diet
examples: A high-fibre diet is good for your health.

children.name: eat/have a diet
examples: People in Mediterranean areas generally have a very good diet.

children.name: live/exist on a diet of sth
examples: The people lived mainly on a diet of fish.

children.name: feed sb on a diet of sth
examples: Kids should not be fed a diet of hamburgers and sugary snacks.

children.name: a diet high/rich in sth
children.definition: which contains a lot of something
examples: In the West many people eat a diet high in fat and salt.

children.name: low-fat
children.definition: (of a diet) containing only a small amount of fat : ít béo
examples: a low-fat diet

children.name: lose weight
children.definition: to become thinner, either because you have been ill or because you want to look more attractive, be healthier etc:sút cân/ giảm cân
examples: The best way to lose weight is to eat less and do lots of exercise.
I’m really worried about my grandmother -- she’s lost a lot of weight recently.

children.name: lose three kilos/ five pounds etc
examples: Alec lost seven pounds in a week and had to be re-admitted to the hospital.

children.name: slim down
children.definition: to become thinner, especially by eating less and doing more exercise:giảm cân
examples: She’s really slimmed down a lot since I last saw her.

children.name: slim down to eight stone/ 100 pounds etc
examples: He’s trying to slim down to eleven stone.

children.name: shed
children.definition: to lose a particular amount of weight quickly:giảm (bao nhieu)
examples: I’d like to shed a few pounds.
Stone’s doctor ordered him to shed some weight and quit smoking.
Gascoigne has shed nearly 6 kilos in pre-season training and looks much fitter.

children.name: waste away
children.definition: to become dangerously thin and weak, usually as a result of illness:gầy mòn ốm yếu
examples: There was nothing we could do -- she just wasted away and within six weeks she was dead.
His muscles were slowly wasting away because of his illness.

children.name: sb who does not eat meat
vegetarian
children.definition: / veggie  a person who does not eat meat for health or religious reasons or because they want to avoid being cruel to animals : người ăn chay
examples: Of the four million people who have become vegetarians in Britain, nearly two-thirds are women.
Our youngest daughter is a vegetarian.
dishes suitable for vegetarians
I’m thinking aboutbecomingavegetarian.
vegetarian[B1]/ veggie[informal][adj]not eating or including meat
vegetarian cooking/food
a vegetarian dish/meal
a vegetarian restaurant
She's recently gone/ become vegetarian.

children.name: vegan
children.definition: a person who does not eat or use any animal products, such as meat, fish, eggs, cheese or leather : người ăn chay
examples: Vegans get all the protein they need from nuts, seeds, beans and cereals.
vegan[adj] not eating, using or including any animal products
a vegan diet
She decided toturnvegan after watching a documentary about how poultry is raised.

children.name: to eat less to lose weight
diet
children.definition: to eat less in order to lose weight:ăn kiêng
examples: I’ve been dieting for two months and I’ve lost 6 kilos.
She dieted and went on exercise programs but nothing seemed to work.
You should be able to reduce your weight by careful dieting.

children.name: diet
children.definition: when you eat less food over a period of time because you want to become thinner or healthier: chế độ ăn kiêng
examples: I’ve tried all the diets and they never work.
This new diet involves eating very small amounts throughout the day.
Shewent ona starvation diet and ended up in hospital.

children.name: be on a diet
children.definition: to only eat certain foods in order to lose weight
examples: No cake, thanks – I’m on a diet.

children.name: go on a diet
children.definition: start eating less or only some types of food
examples: I really ought to go on a diet.

children.name: follow a diet
children.definition: only eat certain types of food
examples: You will feel better if you follow a low-fat diet.

children.name: stick to a diet
children.definition: continue to follow a diet
examples: Most people find it hard to stick to a diet.

children.name: a strict diet
children.definition: in which you eat a very limited amount or range of food
examples: She followed a strict diet for several weeks.

children.name: a crash diet
children.definition: a very sudden and strict attempt to lose weight
examples: It’s better to lose weight gradually than to go on a crash diet.

children.name: a low-calorie/low-fat etc diet
examples: A low-calorie diet should solve your weight problem.

children.name: a starvation diet
children.definition: in which you eat very little
examples: A starvation diet can have negative health effects.

children.name: necessary food and substances for a good health
nutrition
children.definition: food considered as something that is necessary for good health and growth: chế độ dinh dưỡng
examples: Nutrition and exercise are essential to fitness and health.
a nutrition expert
poor/good nutrition
Poor nutrition can cause heart disease in later life.
Goodnutrition is essential if patients are to make a quick recovery.
improvements in nutrition
nutrition[ U ] the scientific study of the process of taking in and using food: khoa dinh dưỡng
She's a professor of nutrition at ColumbiaUniversity.
nutritionist[ C ] an expert on the subject of nutrition : chuyên gia dinh dưỡng
The doctor advised him to see a nutritionist about his diet.
nutritional[C1]/ nutritive[adj] relating to nutrition : dinh dưỡng
Chemical sweeteners have no nutritionalvalue.
the nutritional requirements of pregnant women
nutritional deficiencies

children.name: nourishment
children.definition: formalgoodness that you get from food, which helps your body to stay healthy : dinh dưỡng
examples: There's not much nourishment in fast food.

children.name: lack of proper nourishment
examples: The soil provides nourishment for plant roots.
A growing child needs proper nourishment.
Calves rely on their mother’s milk to provide nourishment.
The foetus gets nourishment via the mother’s blood supply.
Young babies obtain all the nourishment they need from their mother's milk.

children.name: malnutrition
children.definition: physical weakness and bad health caused by having too little food, or too little of the types of food necessary for good health : suy dinh dưỡng
examples: Many of the children showed signs of malnutrition.
A survey of US households found evidence of malnutrition in those persons with the lowest incomes.
Many of the refugees aresuffering fromsevere malnutrition.

children.name: bulimia
children.definition: a mental illness in which someone eats in an uncontrolled way and in large amounts, then vomits to remove the food from their body : chứng háu ăn
examples: bulimic[adj]

children.name: anorexia
children.definition: (nervosa) a mental illness that makes someone stop eating : chứng biếng ăn
examples: Reports of anorexia and other eating disorders are on the increase, with 6000 new cases in the UK every year.

children.name: comfort eating
children.definition: eating because you are feeling worried or upset and not because you are hungry :chứng ăn vì lo lắng, buồn bã chứ ko phải do đói

children.name: deficiency disease
children.definition: a disease which is caused by not eating enough of particular types of food that are necessary for good health : bệnh do suy dinh dưỡng
examples: deficiency diseases, for example scurvy

children.name: calorie
children.definition: a unit for measuring the amount of energy that food will produce :
examples: A potato has about 90 calories.

children.name: sth has/contains calories
examples: These yoghurts have approximately 90 calories per pot.

children.name: count calories
children.definition: control your weight by eating fewer calories
examples: Women tend to count calories more than men.

children.name: burn
children.definition: up/off
examples: calories(= use up the calories you have eaten )Even walking will help you to burn up calories.

children.name: low-calorie
examples: She's on a low-calorie diet at the moment.

children.name: high-calorie
examples: High-calorie foods are usually fatty.

children.name: be high/low in calories
children.definition: contain a lot of/few calories
examples: Sweets and chocolates are very high in calories.

children.name: somebody's daily calories
children.definition: that someone eats every day
examples: Americans get 22% of their daily calories from snacks.

children.name: empty calories
children.definition: that do not contain anything good for your body
examples: Sugary drinks are full of empty calories.

children.name: calorie intake
children.definition: the amount of calories someone eats
examples: There are several ways you can reduce your calorie intake.

children.name: calorie content
examples: Pizzas have a very high calorie content.

children.name: intake
children.definition: the amount of food, drink etc that you take into your body : lượng nạp vào
examples: intake of
Try to reduce your intake of fat.
a high/low intake
a high intake of carbohydrates
food/alcohol/calorie etc intake
Sickness may develop from inadequate fluid intake.
